SHORT_DESCR.P: NHS Ealing CCG is looking to commission a single contract for Out of Hospital services for adults and children from April 2019.

The CCG is seeking expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced healthcare providers who can provide demonstrable evidence of a track record in transformation and integration across the health and social care economy and is able to set out how they will respond to the need to drive focused change over course of the Contract whilst at the same time having a strong grip on the provision of care that is being delivered.

The successful bidder will be expected to deliver services as currently commissioned on day one and then enter into the transformation journey in partnership with the CCG, services users and carers, general practice, the local authority and other stakeholders.
NHS Ealing CCG is looking to commission a single contract for Out of Hospital services for adults and children from April 2019.

Aligned to the NW London Health and Care Partnership delivery plan, once commissioned, the provider will be responsible for the coordination and delivery of all community services in Ealing, removing the constraints of separately held multiple contracts, and providing a unique opportunity to commission care that can be fully coordinated and integrated and able to respond to patient need rather than operate in rigid service lines. This will be a building block in the development of integrated care systems for Ealing in support of the NW London Health and Care Partnership ambition for an integrated care system for North West London.

It is important that the successful bidder undertakes to lead, deliver and coordinate a holistic package of community care working in an integrated and coordinated way with primary care and acute care.

The CCG is seeking expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced healthcare providers who can provide demonstrable evidence of a track record in transformation and integration across the health and social care economy and is able to set out how they will respond to the need to drive focused change over course of the Contract whilst at the same time having a strong grip on the provision of care that is being delivered.

The successful bidder will be expected to deliver services as currently commissioned on day one and then enter into the transformation journey in partnership with the CCG, services users and carers, general practice, the local authority and other stakeholders.

The CCG is seeking a strategic partnership and therefore it is envisaged that the contract length will be for a maximum of 10 years. The initial scope of services to be delivered from the April 2019 has been set out within the procurement documentation. However the contract awarded will also contain provisions to enable the CCG to commission additional transformation work with access to funds and extend the scope of services to include an identified additional list of services over the term of the contract. Although neither additional transformational funding nor additional services are guaranteed, for transparency, the potential maximum additional value of these have been included in the maximum contract value for this opportunity.

A Prospectus for the Single Contract for Out of Hospital Services was presented to the CCG Governing Body on 28.2.2018. This document sets out in detail the vision of the CCG and the services within the scope of this procurement. A copy of this document is attached to the Contracts Finder notice:
Access to procurement documents associated with this opportunity will be made available via the EU-Supply Portal from 9.4.2018.

INFO_ADD.P: The CCG intends to hold a briefing session for potential bidders on the 18.4.2018.The primary purpose of this event is to provide organisations that may be interested in participating in the delivery of the contract an opportunity to meet and hear about the opportunity from representatives of the CCG and partner organisations.The event will also be an opportunity for organisations who may be considering participating as a lead or supporting provider to meet and exchange ideas.Further information about the time and location of the event and how to register if you wish to attend will available via the EU-Supply Portal from the 9.4.2018.Bid Response Deadlines:There are 2 deadlines for submission of completed bid responses:
Deadline 1: The deadline for submitting a response to the Selection Questionnaire (SQ) is 12:00 noon 21.6.2018. Ealing CCG will not accept responses received after this time and date.
Deadline 2: The deadline for submission of completed ITT Responses is 12:00 noon 26.7.2018. Ealing CCG will not accept responses received after this time and date.

For the avoidance of doubt, potential bidders who fail to submit a response to the Selection Questionnaire by deadline 1 will not be permitted to submit a subsequent ITT Response. Potential bidders may NOT be notified of shortlisting prior to the deadline for submission of completed ITT Responses, and so should not wait until notified before commencing preparation of their ITT Response. Potential bidders will be notified as soon as possible of the results of the evaluation of their SQ Response following evaluation. For the avoidance of doubt, Ealing CCG will only evaluate those ITT Responses from Bidders who have been short listed following evaluation of SQ Responses.

Minimum requirements for financial standing and competency will be set out in the Selection Questionnaire document. Providers submitting a response to the Selection Questionnaire that does not satisfy these minimum requirements may be excluded from further participation in this procurement.
Maximum Contract Value: There are three components to the financial information, all based upon 2018/19 pricing:
1. A maximum contract value is 450 245 609 GBP over the maximum 10 year contract term. This is the financial component of the award criteria to be competed.

2. Access to potential transformation funding of 47 405 694 GBP over the maximum 10 year contract term. This value will not form part of the award criteria and cannot be relied on as a funding source for bidders

3. Scope of potential additional services over the term of the contract, which has an annual equating to approximately 79 926 000 GBP.This value will not form part of the award criteria and inclusion will be subject to a due diligence process during the contract term-therefore Inclusion of these services should not be relied upon by bidders.Where services are included into the scope a reasonable view of growth in funding may need to be applied.All values are based on 2018/2019 prices.
Additional information will be available on the following Contracts Finder Website: https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/0d3187c5-3441-442c-854c-542dd20ed81e
